Thanks for reporting this issue. eksctl APIVersion has some breaking changes in latetest. The template we are providing is based on older version. Please check https://github.com/weaveworks/eksctl/blob/master/pkg/apis/eksctl.io/v1alpha5/types.go for latest changes. I think allowSSH is changed to NodeGroupSSH.allow.

I get the same error for "NodeGroupSSH.allow: true" The correct is (v.0.5): ¬†¬†¬†ssh: ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†allow: true and you need to provide the public key in the default place. If you don't know where that is, run apply platform and kfctl will tell.

Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jonin>@jonin</denchmark-link> , that helped. In addition to the path (using ), you can also directly provide a key name that exists in your aws account as follows: <denchmark-code>nodeGroups: - name: gpu-nodegroup instanceType: p2.8xlarge desiredCapacity: 1 minSize: 1 maxSize: 1 volumeSize: 30 ssh: allow: true publicKeyName: <key-name> </denchmark-code>
